item.title: Economy
item.description: Economics in Vekllei 📑 ARTICLE Documents 🌺 Note from the Editor Ever wondered how Vekllei people sound and talk? As it turns out, it’s something like Inuktitut blended with French, pronounced by an Australian. This article introduces key Vekllei languages. ⭐ Starred Article This article is complete. It was last updated in November 2020. 1. Introduction #

item.title: Religion
item.description: Religion in Vekllei 🌋 ARTICLE Documents 🚚 Under Construction This page is still under construction, and may be incomplete. 1. Introduction # U pen is the animistic, nondenominational dominant and historical religion of Vekllei. This article is currently under construction, and will soon feature more information about Vekllei’s spiritualism.

item.title: Language
item.description: Language in Vekllei 📮 ARTICLE Documents 🌺 Note from the Editor Ever wondered how Vekllei people sound and talk? As it turns out, it’s something like Inuktitut blended with French, pronounced by an Australian. This article introduces key Vekllei languages. 📯 Starred Article This article is complete. It was last updated in December 2020. 1. Overview # The language of Vekllei is an important part of the project.

item.title: Vekllei Back Up
item.description: The Country of Vekllei 🌺 FEATURE Introduction 🌺 Note from the Editor This is a comprehensive article on the country of Vekllei. If you’re looking for an introduction to the project, click here. 🚚 Under Construction This page is still under construction, and may be incomplete. 1. Overview # Vekllei is the utopian landscape of Hobart's ongoing Petticoat Project. Set ostensibly in Iceland, the society and geography of this country is radically different from our own, and explores new systems of living through a flexible alternate history.
